moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4: I hadn't seen this opening before . By joining the mini-tournament "Danish Gambit" I gained some knowledge and experience about it. This was the starting position of the mini-tournament.
moves.2... exd4: Moving the same piece twice in the opening , I think Silly.
moves.3. Qxd4: See the position I am controlling the centre. My opponent is resting in his home.
moves.3... Nc6: Good move !! Developing and gaining a tempo.
moves.4. Qd1: Back to home for avoiding more tempo to my opponent.
moves.4... Nf6: Attacking my unprotected centrepawn and controlling the centre.
moves.5. Bg5: 5.Bg5 !? I think bad in this position.
moves.5... Bc5: Wow ! See black's position . He is in commanding position . controlling centre and attacking the wead pawn on f2.
moves.6... d6: Now his light squared bishop is ready to come in the game with controlling e5.
moves.7. Nf3 Bb4: 7. ...Bb4 !? moving bishop twice but pinning the knight for e4 pawn.
moves.8. Be2: Ignoring the 7th black move and preparing for castling .
moves.8... O-O 9. O-O Bxc3: Oops ! thrice a bishop move but making double pawns.
Should I take the pawn in this position or retreat ?
moves.20. f4: No any way to protect f4 pawn so attacking the knight and controlling g5.
moves.20... Nc6 21. Bg4: Knight moved away and now I can protect the f5 pawn.
moves.25. Rf1: Bad one ?? but only way to avoid exchanges in this stage of game.
moves.28. Rh3 Na5 29. Qd1: looking for attacking the king and support f3 bishop.
moves.32... c6: Hahaha ! first mistake for losing the vital tempo when I need tempo to win.
moves.33. gxh6: Marching ahead and offering the bishop for the tempo.
moves.34. hxg7+ Kxg7 35. Qh5 Rh8: Final mistake and this move making a "three move chess puzzle" for white. Black resigned at the 37th move. I challange the reader to solve the puzzle. THANK YOU  for reading , Please rate this annotation.
